data.title: AutoTarget unarmed buildings again to help AI crush it's enemy

milestone.title: June 2013 Playtest
milestone.description: Things that need testing first because they could jeopardize a stable release.

data.body: This reverts #3337 for ra and the changes introduced by @psydev for d2k/cnc in that regard. The AI needs AutoTarget because it solely uses AttackMove to fight it's enemies.

data.title: Bots don't care for owner change
data.body: I captured enemy buildings in the C&C mod and the AI did not attack the refinery I stole from it, but my units right next to it.

data.title: Various fixes towards LegacyCapture
data.body:
- sniper using Captures, but churches wanting LegacyCapturable
- unable to parse CaptureThreshold/SabotageHPRemoval from yaml
- not firing up INotifyCapture and breaking:
  - sniper transforming the church on capture in ra
  - proc giving away it's contents in cnc

data.title: Undead MCV/Construction Yard when killed during Transformation

milestone.title: June 2013 Playtest
milestone.description: Things that need testing first because they could jeopardize a stable release.

data.body:
This is also exploitable to get invincible units/buildings.

data.title: Allow force-move to disable the harvest activity.
data.body: Fixes #3459.

data.title: Make scrolling in game list faster
data.body: when scolling with mouse, its slow.. Please make it faster..

data.title: More Debug Logging for the Server/Client connection
data.body: I am confused by my findings regarding #3455 and decided to investigate it with more debug logging.

data.title: Set the default buffer size
data.body: to workaround #3455 because .NET/Mono uses either too few 8192 bytes by default or something set by the OS which seems to be problematic for some Windows users with weird network settings.

data.title: Force move doesn't work with harvesters
data.body: This is probably an issue with other activities too.

data.title: Fix D2K harvester animations
data.body: This removes the harvester dependency on RenderUnit (needed for TS), hooks up the harvesting animation in D2K, and fixes the bogus dock animation.

data.title: Rendering glitches

milestone.title: June 2013 Playtest
milestone.description: Things that need testing first because they could jeopardize a stable release.

data.body:
- White lines drawn next to tanks. Noticed this when some tanks were in combat
- Missile contrails are missing
- Cash ticks sometimes dance around

data.title: Add temp banning to servers

milestone.title: June 2013 Playtest
milestone.description: Things that need testing first because they could jeopardize a stable release.

data.title: Implement blocking socket fallback

milestone.title: June 2013 Playtest
milestone.description: Things that need testing first because they could jeopardize a stable release.

data.body:
The logging added by #3429 allowed us to find the cause of the windows server crashes. This is probably caused by the internal send buffer overflowing, but could in principle happen at any time for any reason.

```
Dropping client 0 because dispatching orders failed: System.Net.Sockets.SocketException: A non-blocking socket operation could not be completed immediately
   at System.Net.Sockets.Socket.Send(Byte[] buffer, Int32 offset, Int32 size, SocketFlags socketFlags)
   at System.Net.Sockets.Socket.Send(Byte[] buffer)
   at OpenRA.Server.Server.DispatchOrdersToClient(Connection c, Int32 client, Int32 frame, Byte[] data) in Server.cs:line 386
```

The best compromise would be to try sending without blocking, catch the above exception, then fall back to a blocking send (`socket.Blocking = true; socket.Send(); socket.Blocking = false;`).

We should also compare the default buffer sizes under mono and windows, and set our own default size if necessary.

data.title: Fix shroud glitches once and for all
data.body: This removes the (now) unnecessary indirection introduced during the PPS transition, and restores Shroud's robustness against crazy trait code. Fixes the vis glitches with cargo, and in theory everywhere else (but these were untested).

data.title: Testing Notifico
data.body: Just set up http://n.tkte.ch/OpenRA/OpenRA as a replacement for @ihptru's orabot as http://ihptru.net is now gone.

data.title: Don't discriminate bottom right directions when checking whether a unit is in range.
data.body: Fixes #2205

data.title: "Power-bar" pop-up window displays behind build-tab in RA and D2000
data.body:
The pop-up that displays the exact amount of power that you're currently using, is showing up behind the build-tab when radar is enabled. This occurs in both Dune and Red Alert, but not i C&C as the GUI differs from the other two.

I don't know if this bug appears in any other version than 20130511. The bug was discovered on a 64 bit Xubuntu system.

data.title: server browser, amount of players in game
data.body:
In the server browser, the game shows how many players are waiting to play. But specs are treated as players. E.g. if there are 4 players waiting and 1 spec on a 6 players map, in the server browser it shows 5/6 players. That is wrong. Its 4 players and 1 spec. 

<bountysource-plugin>

---

Want to back this issue? **[Place a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/418695-server-browser-amount-of-players-in-game?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.title: Units dieing in transports cause a shroud glitch
data.body: They leave a fog hole at the place where they were loaded when they die. It lasts forever and gets unrevealed by friendly units who can get lost in it. Similiar to #2726.

data.body: to avoid problems related to it such as #2983 and wrong kill/deaths statistics as suggested by @pchote in IRC.
